name: Flutterflesh
description: The Flutterflesh is a Large Undead creature with a skeletal appearance, capable of both walking swiftly and flying short distances. Its body is covered in bone spurs that inflict piercing and necrotic damage.
memorable: The Flutterflesh's ability to reduce foes to 1 hit point instead of killing them makes it uniquely dangerous in combat.
goals: To incapacitate and torment living creatures on the battlefield while remaining resilient to attacks.
relations: Often encountered alongside other undead creatures or necromancers.
environment: Typically found in dark, necromantic settings or battlefields haunted by death.
strengths: High mobility and regeneration abilities allow it to persist in combat and escape when necessary.
weaknesses: Vulnerable to radiant damage, which can negate its regeneration ability.
attacks: The Flutterflesh uses melee Bone Spur attacks combined with psychic Tormenting Gaze shots, both of which can inflict significant damage.
most_powerful_ability: Creeping Death, which emits necromantic energy in a wide area, causing devastating necrotic damage.
senses: It possesses a passive perception of 17, allowing it to detect enemies effectively.
skills: Skilled in Stealth, making it difficult to detect in shadowy environments.
additional_information: Regeneration at the start of its turn unless it takes radiant or fire damage.
Abilities focus on necrotic damage and debilitating effects.
Can reduce multiple enemies to near death simultaneously with its attacks.
Has natural resistance to nonmagical physical damage.
Turn Resistance allows it to resist being turned by clerics.
test_queries: large flying creature that reduces foes to 1 hp
chaotic evil undead with regeneration powers
mobile undead that deals psychic damage
